info.description:
API Gateway Transactions service allows you to query the API transactions. API Transactions are generated (as events) everytime an API invocation happens. API Transactions may contain the details about the invocation such as request/response headers, request/response payloads, consumer applications and so on.  API Provider may choose to store these events to one or more destinations by using Log Invocation Policy. API Gateway provides different destination options to the API Provider (like API Gateway own data store, relational databases, Elastic Search etc.) where he/she would like to store these events to. By default, API Gateway is chosen as a storage destination for these events.

It is important to note that this REST API queries for the transactions data only from the API Gateway's default datastore.

There are multiple use cases for these transactions data. For instance, you can integrate this API with your billing system wherein these transactional data can be used to compute the usage history of your API for different consumers for monetization usecases. In other scenarios, the data extracted from this service can be used for custom report generation.Any valid API Gateway user can consume this REST service.
info.title: API Gateway Transactions Data Service

get.description: This method can be used to retrieve the number of transaction events for a given API/Application/Plan/Package for a specific period of time. Multiple request parameters of this method provide options to specify the request criteria to match the expected result and most of these input parameters supports regular expression in their values. Along with the mandatory parameters - fromDate and toDate, any one of the other filter criteria should be passed in the request.

parameters.name: apiName
parameters.description: The name of the API  for which the invocation count is required.The exact name must be provided or regular expressions can be used like API_.*

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: The version of the API

parameters.name: apiId
parameters.description: The system generated id for an API.The id of an can be retrieved from the API details screen

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: The name of the Application for which the invocation count is required.The exact name must be provided or regular expressions can be used like APP_.*

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The system generated id for an Application.The id of an can be retrieved from the Application details screen

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: The name of the Package for which the invocation count is required.The exact name must be provided or regular expressions can be used like Package_.*

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: The system generated id for a Package.The id of an can be retrieved from the Package details screen

parameters.name: planName
parameters.description: The name of the Plan  for which the invocation count is required.The exact name must be provided or regular expressions can be used like Plan_.*

parameters.name: planId
parameters.description: The system generated id for a Plan.The id of an can be retrieved from the Plan details screen

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: This is the date from which the count has to be retrieved for the matching filter criteria.It is a mandatory parameter and it should be of the format YYYY-MM-DD. Regular expression support is not available for this parameter

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: This is the date to which the count has to be retrieved for the matching filter criteria.It is a mandatory parameter and it should be of the format YYYY-MM-DD. Regular expression support is not available for this parameter

200.description: Array of transactional events count grouped by apiId and api version.

400.description: One optional parameter along with fromDate and toDate is mandatory

examples.application/json: { "errorDetails": " Insufficient parameters. At least one parameter in addition to the creation date range must be provided."}

401.description: This response indicates that invalid credentials have been provided for the request.
